title: There's one immobile mage that got forgotten about
body:

I don't think you can conclusively say those champs will be in a decent spot before the MYMU comes out.

They will be indirectly impacted by the sweeping changes to their itemization, especially Ori who actually builds Athene's due to her insane mana hunger.  Maybe Morellos + Tear will be enough for her, maybe not.

Karthus' RoA got nerfed.

Heimer actually might be indirectly buffed because of the Zhonyas changes.

The point is they were unchanged despite big changes to their items.  I'm not conclusively saying theyre underpowered or overpowered.

I was actually giving my two cents on why certain mages were picked for updates over others. I have no information on how the item changes will affect certain champions, but I don't think it will be as drastic as people think.

I've been playing with minimal mana regen builds over the last couple of weeks and having a butt load of mana + the meditation mastery doesn't feel any different then having infinite mana due to mana regen. The thing that will change is that you will eventually run out of mana if you aren't careful which will add another layer of mastery for playing a champion and create more fun encounters.

In addition it will define the good mage players from the average or poor mage players with their ability to manage their resources and know the limits of their champions. I also have no doubt in my mind that if certain champions just aren't playable due to item changes that Riot will address them in the coming patches, or just hotfix it if it is bad.

TLDR:
Was commenting on my opinion for which champions got picked for this update over others. Mage item update doesn't look that bad, just different, doubt it will break the game.

That's also fair, I'm reading over the official notes now and some items that will be good for surviving laning are:
- Catalyst. Even though Valor's reward is much better you'll be able to sustain with spell casts, and taking poke gives you mana back so that you can heal some of the poke with spell casts. It's a vicious cycle, will probably be a must buy for a lot of champions.
- Abyssal. Like you mentioned, though it may come down to making the choice, do it rush it or build my negatron cloak to not take as much damage, and then finish Abyssal later.
- Lost Chapter >> Morellos. Gives mana, a buttload of AP, and restores max mana on lvl up (or assists/kill if morellos)
- Tear (somewhat). Refunds a percentage of spell costs and increases your pool making it very efficient. Will have to see if it is a good item to get early or if it is too much of a risk.

Some other options you could go is double doran's rings and then build into your core items. 2 dorans should give enough early regen to get you through early game. The other option is going the economy route with picking up FQC which provides gold generation to slingshot you into other items, while providing some mana regen and okay AP.

Will have to see how it plays out, hopefully this helps with figuring out early items for you once the update goes out tomorrow :)

My only concern is Anivia. She was the only champion in the game that could build mana regen for all 5 items and _make it work._ Having a ton of maximum mana doesn't help when you keep your ult out a long time (and with her update, you'll be keeping it out even MORE than before.)
